website_summaries.verdict: Natural and low-maintenance. Once established, they provide both beauty and benefits that others can't top.
pros: Qualities aquarium hobbyists love – attractive, easy to maintain, eco-friendly, and natural
Excellent at absorbing nutrients to inhibit algae growth
Ideal for fish of all sizes and small crustaceans
cons: Some consumers reported murky water when they first put them in their tanks
Several issues of moss balls that were dry or had brown spots upon arrival

customer_reviews.title: This deal is so much better than Petsmart's $7 for 1 ball
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. Came with 4 balls rather than 3, healthy green, and adequately-sized (after soaking under running water and slightly squeezing). This deal is so much better than Petsmart's $7 for 1 ball.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: These guys are so cool took a little too get them too sink haha ...
customer_reviews.text: These guys are so cool took a little too get them too sink haha but I followed the directions and they really look great in the tank
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Love! LOVE! LOVE these Marimo Moss balls! They arrived in perfect form!
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Marino Moss Balls - three large and the bonus tiny one that's the size of a grape - and they're GORGEOUS. Green and well watered. They came in a small, sealed see-thru plastic bag with no water. But that's okay since Marimo moss balls can be outside water for up to thirty days. Fast shipping and delivery! I've immediately added two of the largest in the 40 gallon Angelfish tank and one large and the tiny bonus one in with my King Betta (Blue Boy) in his Baby Biorb (which he loves). Should I need more Marimos, I'll be sure to order from this vendor again! Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: ICHTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great size, but we're in rough shape.
customer_reviews.text: I received the Marimo balls very quickly and they were quite large. The problem is, they were stored in a lightly damp plastic bag and all of them were mostly brown. One of them fell apart and I threw it away. The others I'm hoping will green up soon, as they are now in my tank under light. There seem to be more yellow than brown after a few days, with patches of green. Will keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Buy at your own risk.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time buying plants on Amazon and my last. I washed these out but now my tank has hydra and some type of white worm. I also got copepods which I don't mind since my fish eat them but the hydra is incredibly bad for my baby shrimp and my otos. I've also had the moss balls a few weeks but they're still mostly brown. My other plants are doing well. I have moss balls I bought from the store in the past that were kind of brown but those turned green soon after going in my tank.
customer_reviews.author: Redd.Chris

customer_reviews.title: Received 4 marimos in wonderful condition, Deep green very fluffy
customer_reviews.text: Received 4 marimos in wonderful condition, Deep green very fluffy. In the short time I've had them they have grown quite a bit (co2 and good light?). My only gripe about them is they had snails (tadpole snails) which have now taken a hold in my tank.
customer_reviews.author: WolfKing

customer_reviews.title: Mine came in dry and full of brown spots.
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived dry and full of brown spots that cover 50 to 70 percent of each balls. The mini/micro ball that was supposed to be a freebie was just a clump that looked like a dog hair ball. I tried nursing them back to life. Setting up a bowl for them. Doing daily water changes (conditioned with Seachem Prime). Providing ample but not direct lighting. After two weeks the brown spots turned to black. I removed clumps of black spots hoping what remains would survive. If I have known these would I arrive in that condition, I would not have ordered them. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nuff Said

customer_reviews.title: Seems Toxic, NOT MARIMOS
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE. While they gave an extra ball, the PRODUCT DOES NOT LOOK LIKE PICTURED. Immediately upon submerging the balls in water, they turned the water brown and started shedding bits of green. After multiple daily water changes over 2 weeks, the balls still stained clear water brown while starting to fall apart, and theyt never got close to the rich Marimo green. I have multiple Marimos from other sources in my aquariums, but these are nothing like Marimos. In the end I decided to toss these into trash rather than risk poisoning my fish. Do not recommend and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Stone

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I received the package with only 3 moss balls when the was supposed to be 4 (lost star for) and they were tiny in size (lost 1/2 star for). I quarantined them as with all my plants. Although they did green up some, they never fully recovered from the shipping. Little by little they disintegrated and rolling them never helped. (Lost 1/2 star) As they were in a fishless, cycled tank with filtration and light, there was no reason for it. It was the first time I tried purchasing plants through this supplier, but the reviews seemed favorable so I did. Never again. Ended up getting the moss balls from my LFS which are flourishing under the same conditions.
customer_reviews.author: PJTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cute little guys
customer_reviews.text: Moss balls are such cute little guys. I don't know that they actually do all the things it's claimed they do, but they look nice in a tank. If you have a black thumb it's pretty hard to kill these. I've dropped them in a new tank to help get the cycle going (assuming they came from a fully cycled tank.) My fish kind of like to pick at them. These were very healthy and about the size of a golf ball. Good green color and well shaped. The price is excellent - for some reason these tend to be expensive. Maybe because they are so slow growing?
customer_reviews.author: TriLei

customer_reviews.title: Fauna as well as Flora
customer_reviews.text: I was delighted to receive these balls. I soaked them in water before adding to the fish tank and a small bright red worm like creature came out with whiskers at the front and rear. I was horrified. I used a parasite guard for a few days and kept the balls in a bowl for days changing the water and using the treatment several times. The first treatment, 4 more little red creatures came out (and promptly died). I am not sure what impact, if any, those creatures might have in a fish tank, but their presence concerned me greatly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Goodness gracious, great balls of algae!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for something green to dress up your space, it's hard to go wrong with these Luffy marimo balls. As long as you're not blasting them with light or completely denying them light, they're basically entirely foolproof. Change out the water once in a while, maybe roll them around if they're getting lumpy, and you'll have gorgeous green "moss" balls practically forever with no effort. Three of my four balls arrived in spectacular condition; one wasn't looking so hot, but I skipped the seller's guarantee (yes, Luffy does guarantee their marimo) to try to nurse it back to health myself. A couple months down the road you'd have no idea there was an off-color runt in my litter.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Mattson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as Always
customer_reviews.text: All of the Marimo Balls I've gotten from Luffy have been excellent and these were no exception. I have some of these "moss" (algae) balls in each of my 4 tanks and they are absolutely doing their job. We have 2 tanks near Windows... and neither have any signs of "normal" algae growth. Just for general info- we do quarantine our Luffy Balls for a minimum of 2 days (as we would with any new living plant or animal) before adding it in with one of our established tanks. And again, these are Living Balls of Agae, the most recent ones I purchased, the Giant Size, were 7 Years Old.
customer_reviews.author: Binks

customer_reviews.title: Slowly greening up.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 marimo showed up nearly dry in a simple plastic bag, and decidedly brown. I put them immediately in a 1/2 gallon jar of water treated with API Stress Coat. A week later the four (now 5 some bits came off so I rolled a new ball) all have new green on them. They still look disappointing for now. This is why 4 stars. I am amused that they fill with air and bob to the surface. For a plant in still water these are very mobile. The only problem is these are recommended for a maximum of 76F but my molly tank is at 78F. So in the jar these will live and hopefully thrive.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: risky purchase
customer_reviews.text: When I received these mods balls they had am odor of ammonia. I have had them in my aquariums with led lights on and they still all look dead. Their color is not the vibrant gem my other mods balls have, they have been in my aquarium for several days. I am not satisfied with this product from marimo pet store. And they are not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: like me, don't know what it is
customer_reviews.text: For anyone wondering, because I didn't know, these are about as big around as a quarter, maybe 1/2 inch to 1 inch high. I don't mean that as a negative toward the sellar at all, just for size. I'm not familiar at all with this so giant may be appropriate for them but misleading with the word giant if you, like me, don't know what it is. For the seller rating, I'm very happy. Ordered this and received in two days, four not three. All arrived green, snail free. If they die (I hope not) well I guess it's my fault since care is listed on ordering and on the shipping package. Not the sellers fault.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: FLUFFY GREEN BALLS
customer_reviews.text: I never used these, but I wanted to add something for my Betta fish. They arrived very quickly and sealed in a plastic bag. The bag had directions printed on it, but I couldn't read it. But reviews had all talked about soaking them in water until they were saturated and then place in aquarium, so that is what I did and now they are nice and fluffy and add some color to my aquarium. I am not sure whether the fish is enjoying them, but I am.
customer_reviews.author: PEG

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: They came in a dry plastic bag and were half brown. I put them in the tank hoping they would turn green and not look dead anymore and they only got worse. I have other natral plants in the tank that have been doing great for over a year now and these balls after 2 weeks are almost comepletely dead. I’m sure some people get lucky with a good product but I surely did not with my set of 4. UPDATE So I gave it a month and they’re worse then when I got them. All brown and gross so I had to throw them out. Don’t waste your money buy them fresh and your local pet store.
customer_reviews.author: ahero97

customer_reviews.title: Months later, my little buddies are still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these back in mid-December 2016 and they sit in a little fishbowl in my kitchen window for me to enjoy while making coffee or doing dishes. They are really cute and are still green and growing. I saw a new little green tuft the other day that looks like a baby marimo maybe? It looks like a tiny piece fell off of one and has started to get round, too. I change out the water 1x a month, and give them a little whirl around the bowl once or twice a week. In the morning there's little bubbles in their "fur" that make them look sparkly and even cuter. Sometimes it's the simple things in life, right?
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Made Aquarium smell Terrible
customer_reviews.text: These arrived in good enough condition, and they did not smell when I received them. Within a week of putting them in the tank, they had the most foul, rotting odor, however. At first I wasn't sure what had happened--my tank never smelled like this! Upon closer inspection, I realized it was these moss balls. I threw them away - it wasn't worth fussing with, and I was concerned for my fish.
customer_reviews.author: Pianoplayingal

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful moss balls that Steve thinks is delicious
customer_reviews.text: **Update so my turtle ate these balls and apparently it does not digest. After quite some time later he ended up throwing up A LOT and it was mostly pieces of these moss balls. So please be careful if you put these with turtles** Steve destroyed the gorgeous moss balls Steve also ate the moss balls Steve is a jerk Don't be like Steve... These were beautiful and looked amazing for about 1.3 seconds. Steve thinks anything we put in his tank is food. Steve is a loser. Oh yea Steve is a turtle...
customer_reviews.author: Whitney K.

customer_reviews.title: Mine arrived today a nice dark green with practically no brown spots
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived today a nice dark green with practically no brown spots. Since I read the reviews first I decided to leave them in isolation for a week or so before putting them in any tanks since I have other live plants, just in case anything hitched a ride with them. I will definitely update my review in case anything shows up. For now though I am super happy with my purchase, they are a good size and very healthy looking. This is a much better deal than $8 or even $10 for one from petco or wherever.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Addition to Any Freshwater Aquarium
customer_reviews.text: These Marimo Moss Balls are really nice. All came well packaged with three large and one small plant. The large ones are around two inch diameter with the small around 1/2". They look really nice in my aquarium but would look nice in a small bottle or office desktop tank. They all came very healthy. I highly recommend the Marimo pet store as this is my second purchase from them. The first was a discounted purchase for sake of review, but I purchased this product because I wanted the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bart M.

customer_reviews.title: I rinsed them out a good bit and inspected their quality
customer_reviews.text: I received them on time with prime delivery. They were packaged in a plastic bag, and slightly moist but not wet. I rinsed them out a good bit and inspected their quality. They seem to be healthy. They are currently dark green and healthy looking. All 4 were decent size, not too different from the ones petsmart sells for 8 bucks a pop. I have three in a fish tank and one in a display vase. I will update on health if things turn negative. As of now, I am very happy with the quality. Also, I did not have any "hitchhikers" with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S Spatz

customer_reviews.title: nice balls!
customer_reviews.text: Four is kind of a weird number of items to work with from an aesthetic point of view - odd numbers of things, like three or five, are best when arranging a collection of something. So I wish these came in packs of five. One of the balls looks a little brown, but I am hopeful that it will perk up now that it's out of the warehouse. Rinse, squeeze, place in aquarium, what for them to take on enough water to sink, arrange! Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wren Leigh

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately mine came with all brown. There is no instruction included in the package. I carefully rinsed the miserable brown balls and put them in the water for 20 mins. They made the water yellow/brown and smell sewage!!! There is no way that I will put them in my aquarium. I see one of them is no longer a ball. I was very excited about getting them for my fish, but they disappointed me so much. Meh.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Filthy, infested & half dead!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not particularly happy with these... at all. I immediately took them out of their ziplock bag and began washing them. I could already tell they were pretty disgusting, and large portions were brown. I let them sit in a cup of conditioned water for 30 minutes, and when I went back there's just a layer of grime at the bottom of the cup. On top of being filthy, they're trying to fall apart. I've washed and rewashed, yet more filth is coming out of them. I'm also seeing a lot of little white specks, which I can only assume are snail eggs. At this current moment, I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Cute, healthy, good filters.
customer_reviews.text: I got four balls about the size of golf balls, maybe a little smaller. They were a little brownish at first, but after a couple of days in water they perked up. I put them in my betta tank after about three days of quarantine. I think he likes them, he kind of rests on them sometimes. The ammonia in my tank went down a couple of days after I got them (my tank is on its first cycle, so it could be a coincidence, but the change was really rapid so I think they help). And they are nice and weird looking, so I'm a fan.
customer_reviews.author: jesiklo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Giant Moss Balls
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product but it is delivered via Amazon Amazons' orders have consistently arrived late and in torn or broken boxes. Not only this but their policy of not publishing negative reviews not only creates a lack of trust but is amazingly frustrating. This is a shame since Marimo pet store has shown definite interest in my opinion which is that your product is excellent, I am very satisfied and would purchase it again. Only not through amazon, this is why I am on their contact us email link and cancelling my account. Amazon has alot to learn about customer service. as far as Marino excellent product and price you have my best wishes!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: ... looked nasty with brown spots everywhere and they felt like there was nothing in it
customer_reviews.text: So I got these they looked nasty with brown spots everywhere and they felt like there was nothing in it. The plastic bag they came in was more dry then wet. I did what I was supposed to do to get them ready for my tanks. Within a couple weeks they started falling apart, they never did come back. It's like they were dead when I got them, I gave them a chance but since they fell apart I just tossed them out before they could contaminate my tanks with their nastiness that they became. I'd look elsewhere for these.
customer_reviews.author: Kd7ctv

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have 1.5 year old marimo moss balls and wanted more when I added a new tank. Ordered a Large 4-pack. They arrived flat and a little dry, some brown spots. When rinsing before dropping them in the tank, I could tell they were more "spongy and loose" than the moss balls already in my tank. Two and half weeks later, two have disintegrated, one is collapsed and is no longer a ball, and one is hanging on. I'm not risking another purchase with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Staczek

customer_reviews.title: All of my moss balls came brown.
customer_reviews.text: I've never purchased marimo moss balls before, but, to my understanding from my research, they should not be brown. These moss balls are brown. There was only one moss ball with any kind of significant green patch and it was only on one side. I followed the (very limited) instructions hoping that they would eventually become green again, but it's been at least three weeks and they haven't. Also, one of the moss balls looks dusty. I'm not sure what this is or whether it's my fault or the Marimo Pet Store's, but overall I am not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Graves

customer_reviews.title: Great price!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't ordered anything alive from Amazon before, so I was a bit nervous... Moss balls came a little dried out, which caused them to turn brown a bit... I rinsed them well and placed them in a jar with some aquarium salt per the directions. After a week the brown is fading away and the green present is lush! They are also larger than i expected... About 2 inches! Smaller ones sell at my local fish store the same price for one as i purchased these 4 for! I love them and am NOT disappointed! Also, I have not found any snails or pests in them!
customer_reviews.author: Bohemian Jewel

customer_reviews.title: They were in good shape. I rinsed them in water and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I received these marimo balls very quickly. They are mostly Green and appear to be healthy. They were packaged in a small plastic zip package. They were in good shape. I rinsed them in water and they are sitting in water in a plastic container at the moment. However upon inspection they seem to have acquired some hitchhikers in their natural process. They did not come off with the simple rinse and soak. So I am treating them with parasite medicine. I'm not to upset as this is a natural product and these things happen. I will update after treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Erika King

customer_reviews.title: Kills Fish & Shrimp
customer_reviews.text: I put these moss balls in a tank to help balance out the ecosystem. They ended up killing off all five shrimp we had. Some months later, after persistent and vigorous cleaning, I tried a betta fish. It was originally in a separate tank and thriving, but when I put it with the moss balls, its health deteriorated. No matter how hard I tried, the betta could not be revived. I suspect that a fungus infection caused the deaths. Why still a two-star then? They are aesthetically pleasing. Still, they are NOT worth the money. One strange thing is that they seem to suck in fish food and other particles.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Made our fish sick unlike other moss balls
customer_reviews.text: The moss balls were smaller than expected. When they arrived they were discolored but as a natural product I decided to try them still. They did have an odor, so I washed them prior to placing in a tank. Shortly after adding them, our Betta got sick. Thought it was a fluke but after two weeks of fish not eating, removed these moss balls (kept another purchased at a pet store), changed the water and our Betta is back to eating. Just FYI, we had the water tested and everything was fine. So it was the balls.
customer_reviews.author: Annette0708

customer_reviews.title: SCAM!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I ordered 6 sets and now have 24 useless fiber balls. Their purposes is to help reduce waste in the tank but these actually ended up making the water quality worse. They claim that they are “natural” but it’s actually a ball of fiber rolled together. Like other people here I put a ball in a cup with chlorine and the chlorine did NOT destroy it, the “moss ball” simply lost it’s color. I spent about $60 for counterfeit goods...how is Amazon still allowing them to sell these as authentic?
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: The other three is beautiful and lush
customer_reviews.text: So it's been awhile since I bought these and stuck it in my tank. One of the balls started dying around week 2 and I thought I would be able to revive it but it's half way dead now. The other three is beautiful and lush. I'm not sure what is happing with the 4th one but that's okay since the other three is so perfect. I'm not actually sure why the 4th one is like this considering I'm treating all 4 of them the same so maybe it's something wrong with the ball? No idea but other than that dying one, the other 3 started browning in small spots but I just turned them and they fixed right up.
customer_reviews.author: Vi Dang

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought they were discolored due to packaging/shipping and thought they may green up and puff up once saturated from being in the fish tank. Wrong, they have gotten worse over time, they are breaking apart and clogging my filter tube with the mossy floaters in the tank. I will continue to buy from a local pet store, these are very small and unhealthy looking. The moss ball on left was purchased through Amazon, the one on the right came from a local aquarium store.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: My Moss Balls came in rough shape and then eventually died...:(...
customer_reviews.text: so... the four moss balls came in dry and a drab olive green in color... not bright green like the one in the picture (taken two days after I received them) that I bought at the pet store a few days before these came... I put them in my tank and figured I would give them a couple of weeks/months to come around... but they never did...:(... and recently have disintegrated into nothing... very disappointed... :(... the one I purchased at the pet store is thriving...:)... I struggled giving you a one star rating... :(...
customer_reviews.author: Phil M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price, and pretty healthy overall
customer_reviews.text: They weren't as bright green as depicted in the product photos; more like a dark evergreen color with some small brown spots. I received four, big sized moss balls, and 3 of the 4 were almost perfectly spherical. One was a big oval shaped, but these are all natural, so I can understand with their disclaimer that they may not all be perfectly round. Totally fine with that. But I noticed that after a few weeks it got really brown, so I tossed it out. But the other 3 are doing well, and they look really nice in the aquarium setting.
customer_reviews.author: KellBell

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy and Moss Balls Healthy.
customer_reviews.text: They came dry packed but packaged very well. I wanted to wait a few days to see how they did before I wrote this. They are very healthy and green. I soaked them in RO water in a cup about 10 mins. Then I gently squeezed them and let them soak a little longer. When I put them in my tanks only a couple floated. I gently squeezed again and they sank to the bottom. 1 of my tanks is "brackish" water and they are doing great in that one as well. I will be getting more of these. Also, the ones I received (ordered 2 pks) had 3 golf ball sized ones and 1 that was a bit smaller/
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Nice size but looked a tad unhealthy
customer_reviews.text: These Marimo balls are a good price. They arrived quick with prime shipping and are sized appropriately. The only issue was that they were a little brown. It would appear after a few days and some carbon they are recovering, but I have received Marimo’s from other providers before that were perfect and looked so fresh I contemplated taking a bite. These suffice though and I didn’t see any worms so that’s a huge relief. A tank/terrarium with various invertebrates is hard enough upkeep as it is, let alone having a parasitic infestation.
customer_reviews.author: CDizzie

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 of my female bettas died with ICH and another disease - fin rot or skin flaking
customer_reviews.text: I guess i didn't realize that these should be quarantined or that i needed to treat them like a live animal. The moss ball carried multiple diseases and killed 4 of my 7 female bettas - all of which were healthy before. They died quickly and very sick. I am upset- as I have had them a long time. Please make more notations about this risk factor!!!!! I can't believe i put something in their tank that killed them. I am still treating one of my males and the reamining 3 female bettas. I hope they make it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kahan

customer_reviews.title: The Trouble with Tribbles is........you end up with too many
customer_reviews.text: When I opened these up, they reminded me of Tribbles, something fans of the original Star Trek show will remember. Instead of cute little fur balls, these are cute little moss balls. They were delivered in healthy condition. The shrimp immediately loved sitting on them, the fish were curious at first, then ignored them. The only down side is I got carried away with ordering and ended up with too many for my two tanks, my fault. Wish I could super size them and take them out of the water, I wouldn't mind sitting on one myself.
customer_reviews.author: krenTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mossy Friends for My Betta!
customer_reviews.text: These moss balls were a purchase for my betta tank. I received 4 balls, and they arrived in good health - they were soft and green. They came with a charming little care sheet that really made me feel like I'd just adopted a new pet. :) I've had them in my tank for a little over 2 months now, and they are just as green and happy as the day they arrived. My betta doesn't interact with them much, but they are a great addition to give my tank depth.
customer_reviews.author: C. Favole

customer_reviews.title: It’s a NO!
customer_reviews.text: Probably should have read the reviews before purchasing these but I was in a rush. Honestly, not sure what I expected but, what I got looked gross. So they won’t go in my fishy fishy’s tank. So my first concern was the overly moist bag. Inside the bag was 4 dark almost black, green balls. You could tell they were extremely wet from looking at them, like they had been dipped in water. There was random specks of debris in the bag as well. Add this all together it just put me off.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Ford

customer_reviews.title: Meh, not great quality.
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: While my thoughts on the product are the same, the customer service is great! They reached out and rectified the situation and I appreciated it very much. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I'm not impressed. While the size description is fair, my marimo balls had brown spots and one even unraveled into a flat piece when I rinsed them off. Disappointing. I ordered two packages, and about half of them are in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: These were a total waste of time and energy
customer_reviews.text: Well I only got 3 and they were dead as a door nail. No amount of treatment brought these guys back. They just fell apart and started to stink even with water changes so we had to throw them out. These were a total waste of time and energy. I felt bad because our sons fish seemed to like it for half a day then ignored it as it continued to die.
customer_reviews.author: Zeya

customer_reviews.title: We had a very active tank full of snails and ...
customer_reviews.text: We had a very active tank full of snails and fish. I put two of these balls in yesterday afternoon and in the past 24 hours, ALL of our snails have died and half the fish have died. My daughter is devastated. The only thing different was the addition of two balls. We put the other 2 balls in our turtle tank and I removed them from there fearing for the turtles lives too. :(
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: 3/4 great! -- Can't complain for the price!
customer_reviews.text: 3/4 of the marimo moss balls I received were great quality overall, the 4th was small (half the size of the others), and fell apart once put in water. BUT the 3 that were as advertised are great. They came mailed in a little plastic bag and were seemingly dried out upon delivery. I gently put 1 into my Berta's tank, squeezed the moss. All a few times under water, and let it gently sink. It puffed up nicely after a few minutes, and my betta must like it because he was literally rolling on it earlier!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I approve!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I was forewarned by the description of the product and the reviews that my moss balls might come brownish in parts. Mine came brownish in parts and overall a darker olive green color. I placed them in a bowl with water for a week (as described on the packaging description) before putting them in my tank. I love having these in my tank. I have had them for a few months now, and they are still alive (phew!). They never have turned the lush green color as shown in the picture, but I'm still happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S.M. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Good value and product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Only gave 4/5 stars because I believe they introduced snails in my tank. They look great in my fluval spec v nano aquarium my fish shrimp and frog love hiding around these. They came with 4 and within a month or so I was able to turn them into 5. My local petco was selling one of similar size for $10. I got 4 balls for around $6 here. Would recommend, would buy more if I started another tank.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money thinking you're getting a deal. The moss balls I received were too far gone to even use. They looked like they had been in someone's tank for awhile, and were so full of crap that there was no saving them. When i tried to rinse them out and use them, they were falling apart. I've been using moss balls for years and I know what they look like when they've reached their limit and need to be changed.
customer_reviews.author: This Happy Homeschool

customer_reviews.title: Ugh.  They Died.  Wasted My Time/Money
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and reviews advice carefully and these things still died. They were actually terrible. Please go with another brand. I bought small ones (find my review and read it) from another company and they were FANTATSTIC and are still going strong weeks later. These huge ones died the next day. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Bookwyrm

customer_reviews.title: They can't hurt my pond -
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for algae control in my pond. Since I just received them and put them in the pond, I'm not sure if they work or not however everything I have read about 'Marimo Moss Balls' tells me that they certainly can't hurt the pond. I've read that you must remove them from pond (or fish tank) and squeeze them out periodically (about every 2 weeks) to get rid of the mess they have accumulated including gasses & fish waste. Hope this helps - and I will update this review in about a month.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi- NOLA-PI

customer_reviews.title: Really nice moss balls for your aquarium!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great buy. After price comparing with a couple of local pet stores, I decided on these based on price and quantity--I got an extra large moss ball for about half the price. Quality is great, too. I was a little skeptical they way they were shipped but all the moss balls arrived healthy and seem to be thriving after three weeks in our aquarium. I can't really tell if they've had any effect on tank algae but I didn't really have a big problem to begin with. They are an attractive addition to our aquarium. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Halls

customer_reviews.title: Good value but quality variable
customer_reviews.text: - actually get 4 - nowhere near is bright green as pictures - much darker green - one was deformed with one side ragged - like a chunk was taken out - one had pale brown spots despite constant manual rotation - much cheaper than marimo bought in pet store - 4 for price of one - sand and poop will stick to this, but release readily - it does shed small pieces when agitated CARE TIPS - no direct sun, rotate regularly, weekly water change, - put in 5% salted water with some ice cubes to induce growth/greening (not confirmed)
customer_reviews.author: hypermile

customer_reviews.title: my corals appeared more brilliant, colors seemed deeper and my fish more active
customer_reviews.text: I put four of these, the larger ones, in my 50 gallon saltwater tank yesterday afternoon. Woke up this morning to incredibly clear water, my corals appeared more brilliant, colors seemed deeper and my fish more active. I had just performed maintenance and a water change using Red Sea but the clarity was just not what I knew it could be. These really helped! My emerald green crab loves them!! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Brown and sickly
customer_reviews.text: Arrived brown. I contacted manufacturers. They said it would clear up in some time. It never did. They are brown and sickly looking. Update October 31: Now they have started to disintegrate and are literally falling apart and chunks are floating in the tank. I had to fish them out and throw them away. And I am still trying to clean all the chunks of dead moss from the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I cant keep these alive to save my life
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 for my very first betta tank, and 4 for my second. The first two turned brown and one split and fell apart. My new ones are getting yellow patches. My tanks are fully cycled, I turn them, I clean them, I've fertilized them. The only thing I can figure is that a betta tank is too warm, and their getting too much light. (Even though I've moved them to shady parts of the tank) I'm really sad because they are so cool looking.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Gee Bee

customer_reviews.title: These marimo are so wonderful! They arrived in a bag
customer_reviews.text: These marimo are so wonderful! They arrived in a bag, and needed to be rinsed a bit before adding them to a terrarium. I kept them in a cup in the refrigerator for 3 days and changed the water everyday to make sure they were nice and clean. There was one Marimo that was slightly splitting, so I had to be gentle while washing; but it's completely natural for Marimo to do so when propagating. Once it's split a bit more, I'll roll them into 2 separate balls. Definitely ordering more very soon! I'm very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grow and keep green! Recommended for every fish tank.
customer_reviews.text: These cute little moss balls are probably the easiest plants to grow in a fish tank. Even if your tank is comprised of silk or plastic plants, I highly recommend these to compliment the tank's environment. My shrimp love to pick food off of them. It is possible to tear these balls in half to make more, but the growth rate is minimal. I personally combine a few of these with a suction cup soap dish to make a baffle to dampen my filter's output. This makes the surface a bit less turbulent for my Betta.
customer_reviews.author: drivec

customer_reviews.title: Stinky and dirty marimos
customer_reviews.text: Four balls arrived covered in brown spots. Smelled bad. Gave them a triple rinse and squeeze. Put them in my cycling tank and the water turned filthy. One is falling apart. Wish I would have read the negative reviews before purchasing. Hoping my tank isn't infected with unwanted tagalongs from these marimos. The marimos I purchased from the other vendor arrived green, no spots, no bad smell and didn't dirty my tank water.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good buy for the person who likes having a little bit of living greenery in their room. I love the fact that they only need indirect sunlight and they've been nice and green for the last three weeks. On top of that all, they're super easy to take care of (only needing a change of water every 1-2 weeks) so even those with a black thumb will enjoy this product. the package arrived quickly and the moss balls were as expected (mostly green with one or two brown spots. Overall very happy to have bought these at such a great price and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mae H.

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t checked to see if these were restocked, but, this is the vendor to buy from...
customer_reviews.text: HUGE, HEALTHY and totally ROUND moss balls, I attempted a second order & ad said restock date unknown, possibly not at all. So, bought four more (from another vendor) that were puny, flat and pretty pathetic looking- the only plus was they were at least ALIVE! If the Luffys are restocked, they are the ones to buy!
customer_reviews.author: SJD

customer_reviews.title: Clogged my filters
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to work because they are so cool looking but they came apart in chunks & kept clogging my filter. It took me hours to get out all the pieces & had to take both filters off & rinse all the chunks caught inside. It was a lot of extra work. These didn't work out for me like I wished so I will continue to just stick to plastic decor.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: As Described
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leary about purchasing waterlife plants by mail, however the moss balls arrived quickly and packed well. They appeared a dark gray green color, I rinsed thoroughly in distilled water, placed a couple in each of two beta tanks, a couple sank right off, the other two were semi-buoyant. The next morning all were at the bottom, looking much brighter green, and continued to brighten over next couple days. They're not quite as green as pictured [about 2-3 tones darker]. They look good. I would buy again; and probably will for a much larger tank I'm assembling.
customer_reviews.author: James B Nightingale

customer_reviews.title: 9/12/17 This is a "NEW" order. The seal on ...
customer_reviews.text: 9/12/17 This is a "NEW" order. The seal on the baggie was open and the moss balls where dry. I am hoping that putting them in my tank will catch them in time. My last 3 different orders have been disappointing. I hope this gets corrected soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 8 moss balls thinking that I would receive 6 golfballs and​ 2 nanos. What I got were 7 HUGE moss balls and 1 "pregnant" moss ball! They were so healthy and huge! Actually just like the pictures! After a quarantine period I placed they in my tank and so far they are doing great! I separated​ the pregnant one and now have 9. I guess I just got really lucky, but I was really really impressed with these. For this price, goodness what a deal. Would definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Halena

customer_reviews.title: turtles already had two of the "fake" moss balls I got from pet smart, so they didn't seem to care about them ...
customer_reviews.text: Received very quickly, turtles already had two of the "fake" moss balls I got from pet smart, so they didn't seem to care about them one way or another. The fish were very curious. Always used these until I heard about the real deal. I'm excited to see how things go over next few days to see if turtles bother them. Color of balls were pretty. Hope they do as well as predicted to help with nitrates and fresh environment. I clean and change filters often to keep tank clean for community. This could be my new secret weapon.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Depperschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty addition to my aquarium
customer_reviews.text: I received my four moss balls (about the size of a golf ball) and I was surprised how green they were. I figured they wouldn’t be in great shape after being shipped for such a long distance. They really make a great accent to my aquarium! They aren’t perfectly round but I don’t mind. I try to move them every other day so all parts of the ball receives sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kwock

customer_reviews.title: I received four marimo moss balls, but unfortunately they ...
customer_reviews.text: I received four marimo moss balls, but unfortunately they were brownish when they arrived, and I was not able to revive them even after adding the appropriate amount of liquid CO2 and nitrogen additive in the water. They came in a bag and were slighty moist, but because the weather at that time in this area was very hot as it was summer, they may have suffered from being in the hot delivery truck. Because they are cheaper than buying them at the pet store, I may try buying them one more time if I want more.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: These are a bit smaller than I expected to receive. The seller doesn't tell you how big these are when you buy them but I bought them knowing that so I didn't take away any stars for that. Shipping was quick, much appreciated for that. I took away two stars because 1 ball was almost falling apart when I received it and I think a couple of them are dying. I have proper lighting and I also fertilize. All my other plants seem to be doing well. I will write up a follow up review down the road if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: huskers

customer_reviews.title: Buy loca if you can... these are not worth it
customer_reviews.text: They were supposed to become green after a while.. well they never did. Fortunately I didn’t have problems with hitchhikers but later I found these balls from a local aquarium store and realized what a difference there was between the store bought ones and these luffy balls! First two pics are of these balls and the third is a piece of the local bought one. See the difference in green!
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: first batch one was received almost dead & still I'm trying my best to treat it
customer_reviews.text: Update: Tried several since I wrote my previous review to treat them in vain. I tried every possible solution I can find on the web. But can't return what is dead to live. I had to remove them from the tank as they started deteriorating. .... Initial review: This is the second batch I order, first batch one was received almost dead & still I'm trying my best to treat it. second batch they are almost dead :( all of them
customer_reviews.author: nalqadah

customer_reviews.title: Pass....not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to add color and interest to our aquarium. We have moss outside that is this color and knew that nature does create this color- it is the reason we purchased these- the color. This picture is totally retouched, the color is actually a black/green, very dull and dirty. Bought the small and large size and they are all the same ugly dark dirty color. blah. Would never have considered this in seeing the real thing.
customer_reviews.author: MinnesotaShipper

customer_reviews.title: Tastey snack or decoration? Lol
customer_reviews.text: My moss balls came big puffy and green. When I dropped them in the water they floated so all they needed was a little squeeze and they sank to the bottom. I put them in my 50 gallon goldfish tank but that turned out to be a bad idea because my big boy Piranhaconda (feeder goldfish that's 8+ inches now) decided they looked delicious so I put then in my other tanks. I put 2 into my snail and shrimp tank and 2 in my pea puffer and glofish tank and they seem happy with the addition.
customer_reviews.author: SerenitysFirefly

customer_reviews.title: I received FOUR of the most beautiful Moss Balls for a fraction of what I would ...
customer_reviews.text: I work at a pet supply store, and these cost $8 each. I am *SO HAPPY* I ordered these from your company! I received FOUR of the most beautiful Moss Balls for a fraction of what I would have paid at my work! They are lush, green, and large! I am very happy with these and would not hesitate to order more if I get another tank! As soon as I placed these in my tank, my Otocinclus was all over them! He loves them! Thanks for an awesome product! My photos aren't the best because they don't show size, but they *do* show how healthy and green they are! :)
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and pretty big!
customer_reviews.text: Love these little miss balls! They are fun and they add a touch of life to a boring betta tank. The Bettas seem to like it. I catch them laying against the moss balls at night. I got 4 moss balls, 2 of them were only slightly smaller than "giant" so I guess they sent me 2 to make up for it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Darker than pictured, and dying after a few days
customer_reviews.text: One of them seem like it's not going to last, since it's already turning brown. I rinsed them immediately, and then soaked it in an aquarium salt mixture. I changed the water out about 3 times a day, and finally added to the tank. All of them started to float. After squeezing each one a few times, two of them sank to the bottom. Make sure you're squeezing them in the water, and you'll see the air bubbles escape. They look decent, but I don't think the balls will survive for long.
customer_reviews.author: Womazonian

customer_reviews.title: They seemed like more work than the fish
customer_reviews.text: These made my tank water brownish & murky. Perhaps I didn't rinse them well at first. Was afraid for the health of our fish, so removed them, rinsed them several times well & squeezed them out. Put them in treated water without the fish. Basically they just started to make the water gross & smell. Perhaps for people who want to spend a lot of time with tank & plant maintenance? They seemed like more work than the fish, so we threw them out. One plus, they looked kind of nice.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Working Household

customer_reviews.title: These are very cool. They have grown a bit since January and ...
customer_reviews.text: :These are very cool. They have grown a bit since January and are doing well, very green and healthy. My large 22 year old pleco hasn't harmed them, in fact he ignored them from day one. Once in while a small piece of the ball will be adrift and tiny bits stuck in the filter so I think he pushes them around the tank at night. They are supposedly absorbing nitrates. That is a big plus with plecos.
customer_reviews.author: Burton

customer_reviews.title: Adds to my aquarium
customer_reviews.text: My fish do seem to like them a little, but my little fiddler crab loves them. He is always climbing all over them and eating whatever gets caught in them. I haven't noticed if it's made my tank cleaner or not yet, it looks the same. When they came I rinsed them and squeezed them like it said to do, but they still floated in my tank for awhile so I finally got my fishnet and pushed them against the glass of my aquarium to squeeze them more and they sank right down. They're not as green as the picture but they do add more character to my aquarium.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Adorable!
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than I was expecting, these are each smaller than a golf ball and I can hold all four of them in my palm. I did buy two sets, and yes they are MUCH cheaper than at the local pet shop so hopefully they will thrive in my tank and continue to grow. I just put them in my 20 gallon tank today so I will update.... I put one in my small betta tank and he was lying on it within five minutes. So that is pretty cool! 🐟👍
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought these!
customer_reviews.text: I received the moss balls in excellent condition. The goldfish love having them in the tank. They haven't destroyed them and have survived with them picking at it. I think that they will benefit the water quality and are an interesting addition. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my betta's 5-gallon aquarium. Two immediately were turning brown and were covered in a fitting white substance and I threw them out in a couple of days. The remaining 2 are turning brown after less than a month and I will disposing of them soon. My betta ignores them. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Evelina

customer_reviews.title: A great Turtle Toy
customer_reviews.text: These were super great for my turtles when they were teeny - they would chase them around the tank all day. Unfortunately, as the turtles got bigger, the moss balls went from toys to targets. These days I'll still buy a new pack every once and a while for them to mercilessly shred and clog up the filter. The moss always shows up in good shape - I just rinse out some sand and grit and we're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Killday

customer_reviews.title: Browned and came with no instructions!
customer_reviews.text: 0 stars! We received these today. 2 if them were brown all over and 2 had brown spots around it.. It had no instructions with it. I checked other reviews on amazon and cleaned and soaked them in treated water for 30 mins .. the water that I used to clean turned v dirty.. .. I should have returned this.. very upset abt this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy_Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Ok size and color but messy
customer_reviews.text: Size is ok but pieces came off when they were placed in the aquariums and I noticed, even after being soaked for awhile in treated water outside of the aquarium, that they made the water directly around them a little cloudy. I will probably not buy these again, though they look ok after they were in the water for a few days and after cleaning up the bits that floated away from them..
customer_reviews.author: SoulsSong

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the speedily shipped package I thought they were going to be shipped in water and that's my thought to why it's not looking so great but will give the little plants a fighting chance
customer_reviews.text: Thought they were bigger and the ones I got came in half brown but I am going to give them 2 weeks of the quarantine going the extra step to make them as plump or healthy green as possible or at least be able to say I tried. Thanks for the speedily shipped package I thought they were going to be shipped in water and that's my thought to why it's not looking so great but will give the little plants a fighting chance
customer_reviews.author: G!

customer_reviews.title: Very Hardy
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty hardy. I have them in a tank which has had its ups and downs and they are still doing very well. In nature, these get tumbled by the waves to they constantly change sides. This is not the case in my tank so a they tend to pick up algae on them which I have to brush off. I also try to tumble them every week so the bottom doesn't die. I think these have grown some, but I don't have the original measurements, so I can't be sure.
customer_reviews.author: JAH-Just a Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Quite the bargain!
customer_reviews.text: To buy these where I live, I have to pay between $6-$10, and that's just for one! I believe I got lucky, because I was actually sent four; one of which, was decently sized (about two inches wide, and four inches in diameter). As instructed by the information given, I gently rinsed the Marimo moss balls, and they gently went to the bottom of my shrimp aquarium. My shrimp gravitated to these beautiful wonders. It has made my tank even more lively, as the shrimp are going bonkers for these! I absolutely love them, and it was quite the deal for my money.
customer_reviews.author: cicisbo

customer_reviews.title: Was not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Received the moss balls and they were brown which was expected from shipping, after 1week the first ball deteriorated clogging my pre-filter. About 2 weeks later the second one went. 2 balls hung on for about a month, the balls were showing a dark lush green and boom... Turned a light tan color and disintegrated.... Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: ok for a while.
customer_reviews.text: they look good and seem to do well, Im not sure if they really help the water quality or not heck they may not even be real plants. Update: these are great until they start to grow or in my case one fell apart and it was worse then algae and harder to get rid of. it spread every where killed all my plant plugged filters ruined all my decor. I had to sterilize my tank to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer of Quality Products
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have ordered this product from anyone. I learned about this product while researching for my little guppy tank aquarium at home. I am very pleased with the products that I received from you. It had nice color and looked very healthy. Thanks you for your service and good quality of products.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent moss balls!
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived healthy - moist and green. I put them in my tank, they look terrific, my fish and shrimp love poking around in them, and the tank stays clean. Will buy again, and do recommend. If you are unlucky and get some that are damaged in transit or dried out or whatever, just contact the seller and get new ones.
customer_reviews.author: E. Falken

customer_reviews.title: Not so green. Good Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Moss balls were not ball shaped at all, and were almost completely brown upon arrival. I had high hopes, due to other reviews. Update; I got a second set of mossballs. These moss balls were also brown, but they will probably green up in my aquarium. 4 stars for stellar customer service. Will update again if balls green up, I'll let you know how long it takes!
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyOregon

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two packs of 4 and the fish love them. Our Plecostomus is big enough that he can roll them around and every morning they are all in different locations in the tank. I suppose that will help keep them round and he seems to have fun with it. They arrive damp in a zip lock bag and once rinsed and dropped in the tank they greened right up within a day or two. The guppies and swords nibble on them but not enough to cause damage.
customer_reviews.author: Rex S

customer_reviews.title: Lifeless algae...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed and a waste of money. It arrived in this condition, even after I followed the instructions on rinsing them before introducing to my aquarium. I don’t think it will turn to a lively moss ball and I already threw one. It has a strong ammonia smell, but I guess it was absorbed in their facility for it to thrive. I had good experience with luffy in my mini moss and is thriving right now, but this one is different...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew reyes

product_meta.title: 4 LUFFY Giant Marimo Moss Balls --- Aesthetically Beautiful & Create Healthy Environment - Low-Maintenance - Suit All aquarium sizes - Shrimps & Snails Love Them
product_meta.description:
The 4 LUFFY Giant Marimo Moss Balls are the natural live plants that may not be perfectly spherical in shape and lush green in color. You will receive around 1.5 - 2-inch diameter ball which is three times larger than the nano marimo balls. Since we sell 100% non-synthetic and safe marimos, sometimes there might be a few brown spots here and there. Do not consider them damaged or unnatural because just like organic food, real marimos cannot be perfect. A few brown spots just show that the product is natural. Give them proper care and if in a few days, the balls are not healthy green, please write to us and we will send you a free replacement immediately, no questions asked. 

The benefits of adding Marimo Moss Balls in the aquarium are plenty. These moss balls do not require constant attention. In fact, they are very low maintenance live plants. Your shrimps and snails love feeding on the green ball. 

You may also make use of the LUFFY Giant Marimo Moss Balls as a decorative item in social events or for the purpose of gifting. 

Please note that sometimes marimo balls trap air bubble inside which causes them to float. In such a situation, gently squeeze the marimo and pop the air bubble. Release it into the water and you will see them settling down at the bottom of the water tank. 

Note : Since we will send you a live product and it travels a long distance to reach you, give it a gentle wash before using for the first time. Also, in the rarest case of you receiving the product in an unsatisfactory condition owing to bad weather or delay, write to us for a free reshipment or refund. We will solve the issue immediately.
feature_bullets: BRING HOME A LIVE PLANT THAT BENEFITS YOUR AQUARIUM --- The 4 LUFFY Giant Moss Balls are live plants. Fish excreta, debris, phosphate, and ammonia disturbs the natural ecosystem of the water tank. These balls help in creating a thriving atmosphere for the aquatic species.

NO SPECIAL FOOD REQUIREMENTS FOR GROWTH --- Both aquatic organisms and marimo moss balls compete for the same nutrients for growth. Marimos leave a limited room for other organisms to thrive. If marimos are floating, rather than settling down, gently squeeze it and pop its air bubble. Release it into the water and you will see them settling down at the bottom of the tank.

REAL MARIMOS ARE NOT ALWAYS SPHERICAL & MIGHT HAVE SOME BROWN SPOTS ON THEM --- As you buy LUFFY Giant Marimo Moss Balls, you should be able to differentiate between a real and a fake marimo. The 100% natural marimo will not always be spherical in shape or lush green in color. It is perfectly ok to have some brown spots. However, if you do find sparkling green and perfectly spherical marimos, there os a high chance that they are unnatural and synthetically prepared marimos.

ADDS TO THE AESTHETIC BEAUTY & ARE LOW MAINTENANCE --- LUFFY prohibits the usage of dye that imparts artificial green color to the moss balls. Since it distributes non-synthetic marimo moss balls, expect to receive regular/irregular shaped moss balls which are not always in deep green color. Undoubtedly, the marimo moss balls add to the aesthetic beauty of the aquarium and are low maintenance. They simply require some light and freshwater.

SNAIL-PROOF AND LOVED BY SHRIMPS --- Some snails love to feed on live plants, but when it comes to the LUFFY marimo moss balls, they nibble or eat food off it just like a shrimp. Shrimps, on the other hand, gorge on the green stuff and munch on any particle they like. We recommend keeping the marimo moss balls away from fishes such as Koi or goldfish as it’s a tasty snack for them. It’s safe for them, but you don’t want your one pet to eat your plant pet.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
